author: ansgar.eth
content:
It was just explained to me that the main disagreement around the difficulty bomb delay seems to have been the meaning of the word "delay". There are two very different ways of counting:
A) "shift the impact of the bomb by 2.5 months": In 2.5 months, we would be in the same situation as today
B) "restart the bomb 2.5 months from the acd 2 weeks ago (so 2 months from today)": It would take way longer than 2 / 2.5 months to get back to the current situation

author: ansgar.eth
content: it doesn't matter which of those two reference frames we use, we just have to agree on one. Under A, I think a 2.5 month delay would be reasonable. Under B, a 2.5 month restart would basically make the bomb meaningless for the merge.

author: tjayrush
content:
As far as "when" the bomb goes off again, it doesn't matter on which date you do the fork.

Setting it back today for 500,000 blocks vs. setting it back in three weeks by 500,000 blocks arrives at the same place in mid-August. It's counter-intuitive, but that's how it works. (See this: https://medium.com/coinmonks/adventures-in-difficulty-bombing-837890476630).

500,000 blocks is about 10 weeks. 10 weeks from now, the bomb will be where it is now even if you wait three three weeks to do the fork.

The only thing "when" effects is how painful it gets before you fork.
